intro: Phaca pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered phaca, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces achenes as its seed type. Phaca pauciflora is often found in open vegetation and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological niche and limited distribution.
